stimulusHtml: A team of ecologists will select a random sample of nesting robins in a certain region to estimate the average number of eggs per nest for all robins in the region. Which of the following is a correct inference procedure for the ecologists to use?
choicesHtml: A one-sample t-interval for a sample mean
A one-sample t-interval for a population mean
A one-sample z-interval for a population proportion
A two-sample t-interval for a difference between means
A two-sample z-interval for a difference between proportions
